Medicine_190.News Finding: The researchers found as long as the levels remained above 0.5 percent, the sponges could survive.
Medicine_190.Paper Finding: Therefore, the oxygen requirements of sponges might be relatively low .
Medicine_190.News Context: When oxygen levels dropped to zero, some died. The researchers found as long as the levels remained above 0.5 percent, the sponges could survive. "There must have been other ecological and evolutionary mechanisms at play.
Medicine_190.Paper Context: Because these cells are always in direct contact with seawater, they do not rely on the diffusion of oxygen from the external environment into the interior of the animal, nor do they require oxygen delivery via a true circulatory system. Therefore, the oxygen requirements of sponges might be relatively low . Sponges were also observed on the Volcano 7 seamount in the eastern tropical Pacific, where oxygen concentrations ranged from 4.5 to 7.2 μM O 2 .

Reported finding: The researchers found as long as the levels remained above 0.5 percent, the sponges could survive.
Paper finding: Therefore, the oxygen requirements of sponges might be relatively low .

Medicine_tweet_179.News Finding: The association of stress disorders with increased risk of autoimmune diseases across 41 conditions @username
Medicine_tweet_179.Paper Finding: Restricting to participants with more than 5 years of followup, patients with stress-related disorders had a higher cumulative incidence of autoimmune diseases compared with their matched unexposed individuals across the follow-up period (eFigure3intheSupplement).
Medicine_tweet_179.News Context: The association of stress disorders with increased risk of autoimmune diseases across 41 conditions @username
Medicine_tweet_179.Paper Context: A score of zero shows no comorbidities; the higher the score, the more likely the predicted outcome will result in mortality or higher medical resource use. Restricting to participants with more than 5 years of followup, patients with stress-related disorders had a higher cumulative incidence of autoimmune diseases compared with their matched unexposed individuals across the follow-up period (eFigure3intheSupplement). Additional adjustment for medical surveillance level yielded somewhat lower point estimates (eTable 6 in the Supplement) while changing the definitions for history of other psychiatric disorders and autoimmune disease, and the extension of the lag-time period yielded similar results (eTables 7 and 8 in the Supplement).

Medicine_tweet_49.News Finding: Lianas reduce tropical forests' #carbon accumulation and storage   #TheTarzanEffect
Medicine_tweet_49.Paper Finding: This study is the first direct demonstration of liana effects at the ecosystem scale and illustrates the important role of lianas in tropical forests, particularly with respect to carbon budgets.
Medicine_tweet_49.News Context: Lianas reduce tropical forests' #carbon accumulation and storage   #TheTarzanEffect
Medicine_tweet_49.Paper Context: By impacting on tree growth and survival, lianas impact the carbon balance of these forests. This study is the first direct demonstration of liana effects at the ecosystem scale and illustrates the important role of lianas in tropical forests, particularly with respect to carbon budgets. Lianas are increasing in biomass and productivity throughout the tropics, and thus our findings have even greater relevance in terms of the fate of the tropical carbon balance, as well as for global atmospheric CO 2 levels, in a changing climate.
Medicine_tweet_49.text:
Reported finding: Lianas reduce tropical forests' #carbon accumulation and storage #TheTarzanEffect
Paper finding: This study is the first direct demonstration of liana effects at the ecosystem scale and illustrates the important role of lianas in tropical forests, particularly with respect to carbon budgets.

Medicine_tweet_30.News Finding: More evidence for weak correlations between acute hormonal responses & resistance training-induced gains in muscle mass
Medicine_tweet_30.Paper Finding: Acute hormonal responses were correlated with gains in lean body mass (LBM), muscle fibre cross-sectional area (CSA) and leg press strength.
Medicine_tweet_30.News Context: More evidence for weak correlations between acute hormonal responses & resistance training-induced gains in muscle mass
Medicine_tweet_30.Paper Context: Acute hormonal responses were correlated with gains in lean body mass (LBM), muscle fibre cross-sectional area (CSA) and leg press strength. There were no significant correlations between the exercise-induced elevations (area under the curve-AUC) of GH, fT and IGF-1 and gains in LBM or leg press strength. Significant correlations were found for cortisol, usually assumed to be a hormone indicative of catabolic drive, AUC with change in LBM (r = 0.29, P \ 0.05) and type II fibre CSA (r = 0.35, P \ 0.01) as well as GH AUC and gain in fibre area (type I: r = 0.36, P = 0.006; type II: r = 0.28, P = 0.04, but not lean mass).
Medicine_tweet_30.text:
Reported finding: More evidence for weak correlations between acute hormonal responses & resistance training-induced gains in muscle mass
Paper finding: Acute hormonal responses were correlated with gains in lean body mass (LBM), muscle fibre cross-sectional area (CSA) and leg press strength.
Medicine_tweet_30.displayed_text:
Reported finding: More evidence for weak correlations between acute hormonal responses & resistance training-induced gains in muscle mass
Paper finding: Acute hormonal responses were correlated with gains in lean body mass (LBM), muscle fibre cross-sectional area (CSA) and leg press strength.
